Sure, here's a possible test plan for this project:

1. Motor speed control:
a. Test that the speed control potentiometer can adjust the speed of the motor from 0 to 3500 rpm.
b. Verify that the motor speed is stable and accurate at different set points.
c. Test that the motor can be stopped at any speed set point.
d. Verify that the motor speed can be ramped up and down smoothly over time.
2. Motor direction control:
a. Test that the forward and reverse switch can change the motor direction.
b. Verify that the motor rotates in the correct direction based on the switch position.
3. Over-temperature protection:
a. Test that the motor can be stopped when the temperature sensor detects an over-temperature condition.
b. Verify that the motor can resume operation when the temperature has cooled down.
4. Over-current protection:
a. Test that the motor can be stopped when the current sensor detects an over-current condition.
b. Verify that the motor can resume operation when the current has returned to safe levels.
5. Display:
a. Verify that the display shows the current motor direction, speed, and temperature.
6. System integration:
a. Test that all hardware components work together as expected.
b. Verify that the software controls the hardware as specified in the requirements.
c. Test that the system can handle different combinations of set points and operating conditions.

Note: The above test plan is not exhaustive and additional tests may be required based on specific project requirements.
